meanings.definition: To move a computer cursor by sliding a mouse along a surface.
meanings.sent1: She moused over the icon to open the program.
meanings.sent2: He moused quickly to click on the link.
meanings.sent3: The cat moused around the screen, trying to catch the elusive cursor.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moused across the touchpad with precision.
meanings.sent5: The student moused through the document to find the relevant information.

meanings.sent1: The cat moused in the barn to catch the rodents.
meanings.sent2: They moused in the fields to control the pest population.
meanings.sent3: The dog moused around the house, searching for any hidden mice.
meanings.sent4: The owl moused silently through the night, preying on unsuspecting rodents.
meanings.sent5: The farmer moused in the cellar to protect his stored grains.

meanings.definition: To behave in a timid or sneaky manner.
meanings.sent1: She moused around the edges of the room, avoiding attention.
meanings.sent2: He moused his way out of trouble by staying quiet.
meanings.sent3: The child moused out of sight when asked about the broken vase.
meanings.sent4: The spy moused through the crowd, trying to remain unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: The thief moused through the dark alley, looking for an easy target.
